meta.content: Request for proposal: Business Management and Financial Support Services

a.span: Miembros del consejo de la comunidad

a.font: Business Management and Financial Support Services

strong.font: Videos tutoriales para el aprendizaje en línea.

div.span: Estimados padres de familia y tutores,

br.font: La superintendente de educación del estado de Utah anunció que todas las escuelas se van a cerrar. Asi nuestra escuela se cerrará a partir del
como medida preventiva para frenar la propagación del virus Corona. Estamos preparados para lidiar con esta situación ya que anticipamos tal acción.

br.span: Estos son nuestros planes para las próximas dos semanas.

Los padres o tutores pueden recoger una bolsa de comida para cada niño desde las 12:00 del mediodía hasta las 5:00 pm del lunes 16 de marzo del 2020. La bolsa tendrá tres desayunos y tres almuerzos para el 16, 17 y 18 de marzo. Los padres regresarán el martes 24 de marzo de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. para recoger otra bolsa con 4 desayunos y 4 almuerzos para los días 24, 25, 26 y 27 de marzo.

El director de educación especial se comunicará con cada padre a más tardar a las 12:00 del mediodía del lunes 16 de marzo para crear un horario para continuar recibiendo los servicios educativos según lo requerido por el IEP.

Cada estudiante recibirá un paquete para completar durante el horario escolar en casa. El paquete contendrá matemáticas, artes del idioma inglés y otras materias según lo haya planeado por maestros individuales. Estos paquetes deberán devolverse el martes 24 de marzo entre las 8:00 a.m. y las 3:45 p.m. Se recogerá un nuevo paquete para los cuatro días restantes. Tendremos información adicional antes del viernes 27 de marzo sobre cómo procederemos el lunes 30 de marzo en adelante.

The state superintendent announced a 2-week school dismissal. Esperanza Elementary School will be dismissed starting Monday, March 16th as a preventative measure to slow down the spread of the Corona Virus. We are prepared to deal with this situation since we anticipated such an action.
​
These are our plans for the next two weeks.

Parents can pick up a bag for each child from 12:00 Noon to 5:00pm on Monday, March 16th, 2020. The bag will have three breakfasts and three lunches for March 16th, 17th, and 18th. Parents will return on Tuesday, March 24th from 7:00am and 5:00pm to pick up another bag with 4 breakfasts and 4 lunches for march 24th, 25th, 26th, and 27th.
​

The director of special education will contact each parent no later than 12:00 noon on Monday, March 16th to create a schedule in order to continue to receive educational services as required by the IEP.

Each student will receive a packet to be completed during school hours at home. The packet will contain math, English language arts, and other subjects as planned by individual teachers. These packets will need to be returned on Tuesday, March 24th between 8:00am and 3:45pm. A new packet will be picked up for the four remaining days. We will have additional information before Friday, March 27th about how we will proceed on Monday, March 30th and thereafter.
​

div.span: Esperanza Elementary provides the environment that fosters what each student needs to become biliterate, multicultural, and to acquire the skills and attributes needed to effectively serve in our local and global community. Esperanza welcomes students of all backgrounds and ethnicities. Esperanza values a diverse school community. Esperanza’s school design helps all students to be academically successful.

strong.font: What is SafeUT Crisis Chat & Tip Line?

br.font:
The SafeUT Crisis Chat and Tip Line is a statewide service that provides real-time crisis intervention to youth through live chat and a confidential tip program – right from your smartphone.
Licensed clinicians in our 24/7 CrisisLine call center respond to all incoming chats and calls by providing:
We can help anyone with emotional crises, bullying, relationship problems, mental health, or suicide-related issues.

font.span: In accordance with Federal law and U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) civil rights regulations and policies, this institution is prohibited from discriminating on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, and reprisal or retaliation for prior civil rights activity. (Not all prohibited bases apply to all programs.)

br.span: Persons with disabilities who require alternative means of communication for program information (e.g., Braille, large print, audiotape, American Sign Language, etc.) should contact the responsible State or local Agency that administers the program or USDA’s TARGET Center at (202) 720-2600 (voice and TTY) or contact USDA through the Federal Relay Service at (800) 877-8339. Additionally, program information is available in languages other than English.

To file a complaint alleging discrimination, complete the USDA Program Discrimination Complaint Form, AD-3027, found online at http://www.ascr.usda.gov/complaint_filing_cust.html, or at any USDA office or write a letter addressed to USDA and provide in the letter all of the information requested in the form. To request a copy of the complaint form, call (866)632-9992.
Submit your completed form or letter to USDA by:
Office of the Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights 1400 Independence Avenue, SW Washington, D.C. 20250-9410
This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

font.strong: Esperanza Elementary | 4956 West 3500 South | West Valley City, Utah 84120 | (801)305-1450 | fax. (385)722-8252
